resources.string: The Sprengel Museum is an excellent modern art museum.

The Beginenturm (formerly Beguinenturm) is a protected monument on the Hohe Ufer in Hanover. The tower was mentioned for the first time as "De nye Torn" in 1357 and was part of the city fortifications. It was originally built in the Beguin\'s Garden. It\'s just cool to look at.
Museum August Kestner, previously Kestner-Museum, is an art museum. Museum August Kestner is centered on the collections of August Kestner and his nephew Hermann Kestner.

The Buchdruck-Museum was founded in 2002 by writers, printers, bookbinders and other professional colleaguesto preserve and pass on the almost lost specialist knowledge of the art of book-printing. This small but well stocked museum tucked away in Hannover is worth a visit.
The Eilenriede is a 640-hectare (1,600-acre) inner-city park located within Hannover. Endless hiking and biking trails are ready for you to explore.
The Stadtpark Hannover (Stadthallengarten) in Hanover is located south of the Hannover Congress Center in the Zoo district. t is a beautiful spot to enjoy a walk or a breath of fresh air.

The Maschpark in the center of Hanover is a 10-hectare park south of the old town. It was built around 1900 and was the first municipal park in Hanover. A great spot for a picnic, you can enjoy open-air opera in the late summer.
These well-kept gardens are a treasure in Hannover. You can get lost for hours walking around the well-manicured greenery.

The ruins of this Church, originally built in the 14th century, lie as a monument to the destruction of war. It was destroyed during the bombing of Hannover in the Second World War. Now it is a place for quiet contemplation.
This is the house in which the great mathematician, philospher, and diplomat Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz was supposedly boarn.
This is a very cool castle on the outskirts of Hannover in Pattenson. It was built between 1858 - 1869 by King George V to be used as a summer residence. It is worth taking a look.
This is St. John\'s Church. It is a perfect example of Protestant church. The mathematician and philosopher Gottfried Wilhelm von Leibniz is buried in this church.
This delightful restaurant in the south of Hannover serves excellent burgers and cocktails. Sunday is all-you-can-eat ribs!

Craving Indian cuisine? Then try this excellent restaurant in the vicinity of Hannover\'s main train station. The food is tasty and the ambience is cozy and unpretentious. The service is excellent as well.
This authentic Bavarian restaurant is something to experience. Great beer, delicious Bavarian sausages, and crispy pork shanks await you. Come by for October fest for an experience you won\'t forget.
This Italian restaurant in Hannover is a must see. The homemade pizzas are fantastic (and gigantic!). The menu boasts popular italian dishes. Definitely worth a visit.
